thread.title: Prince William gets cheeky with Charles during Coronation rehearsal and the moment is goin | Royal | News | Express.co.uk
thread.title_full: Prince William gets cheeky with Charles during Coronation rehearsal and the moment is goin | Royal | News | Express.co.uk

author: Brigid Brown
title: Prince William gets cheeky with Charles during Coronation rehearsal and the moment is goin | Royal | News | Express.co.uk
text:
Queen Camilla's sister tears up on Coronation Day
Prince William practising his Coronation vow with King Charles III is going viral on social media.
It has emerged after the release of Charles III: The Coronation Year on Boxing Day.
William is meant to pledge his allegiance to his father and then kiss him on the cheek. During the rehearsal, William bends down and kisses Charles on the right side of his face, but it seems like Charles isn’t quite satisfied.
William then asks, “Oh, is it the left side?” before adding, “Your left cheek is better!”. He obliges, giving his father a second peck.
The moment has caught fans’ attention with the clip already amassing half a million views, 20,000 likes and 200 comments over at TikTok .
READ MORE: Prince Wiliam and Princess Kate unfazed by efforts to ‘wound’ with family put first
The actual Coronation took place on May 6, 2023. (Image: Getty) The scene begins with Charles sitting down and William standing in front of him. Charles is dressed in his everyday clothes, a suit, but has the cloak over his shoulders.
William, too, is dressed in a suit. He says part of the vow, but doesn’t finish it, saving the entire pledge for the big day.
And, rather than actually touching the crown, he acts out the motion, and instead of kissing his father, he sort of tickles his face with his hand, but then does lean over to plant one on him.
@princess__jo #royalfamily #fyp #viral #jdsummerdrip #booktok
original sound - Jojo Trending Become an Express Premium member

William pledged his loyalty to King Charles on Coronation Day. (Image: Getty) At first, it appeared, he would just emulate the kiss and save it, like the vow, but, instead he went through with it.
And, not just one kiss, but two.
It’s very rare for the public to see how the royals interact behind closed doors, and this is one of the reasons the documentary is being eagerly embraced.
